text:
So I got the problem figured out after last week using postman and checking the responses.

It turns out that the api calls did not like how I was decalring my payload properties - ``${context.body.id}_progress``
This was instead changed to
`var name = context.body.id+"_progress"`
I would then just send over the name var in the json and this has fixed all the issues

We’re using Jotform to create a calculated form that, based on the equation, would send applicants to pages to let them know what their pre-approved credit is.

The issue is, however, that Jotform does NOT trigger as a non-HubSpot form, making it difficult to accurately track where the leads are coming from.

Is there a way to use Jotform to trigger as a non-HubSpot form so it shows? Or do we need to look into something else?

Hello there! Is the <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-ruby|new ruby API client> following semantic versioning? It says it does in <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-ruby/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md|the changelog> but I keep seeing major version releases for non-breaking changes.
Aloha team! Maybe <@UFBNA9K9A> question- anyone gotten request signature validation to work for CRM Extension’s fetch request for node.js (express)?
`decodeURIComponent` on the req.url and you should be all set

Bummer, turns out that if you’re using *AWS API Gateway and proxying for a Lambda, AWS doesn’t preserve the original HubSpot Sort order for the query params* :confused: Posting here in case anyone has run into this and in case you have heard of this issue before <@UFBNA9K9A>
